Column Comment.0: SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample used in technical analysis.
Column Comment.1: COLLECTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the record describingwhere and how a sample was collected.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: This column is part of the foreign key from ANALYSISSTEP. Use this FK to indicate the specific step in an analysis that was used to createthis sample. For example an analysis step may result in the creation of multiplefractions, each of which is used in further analysis. Use of this column will provideinformation about how the new sample was created, and will allow the new sample tobe described.
Column Comment.4: ANALYSIS SOURCE: This column is part of the foreign key from ANALYSIS STEP.Use this FK to indicate the specific step in an analysis that was used to create thissample. For example an analysis step may result in the creation of multiple fractions,each of which is used in further analysis.
Column Comment.5: ANALYSIS STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: This column is part of the foreign key fromANALYSIS STEP. Use this FK to indicate the specific step in an analysis that wasused to create this sample. For example an analysis step may result in the creation ofmultiple fractions, each of which is used in further analysis.
Column Comment.6: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.7: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.8: COLLECTED BY: unique identifier of the person or company that did the collection ofthis sample.
Column Comment.9: COLLECTED FOR: unique identifier for the business associate that this sample wascollected for.
Column Comment.10: REFERENCE SAMPLE COLLECTION METHOD: a list of the valid methods used tocollect samples, such as coring or sidewall coring, dipping, cutting collection etc.
Column Comment.11: CORE TYPE: A reference table which defines the type of core procedure used duringthe coring operation. For example, conventional, sidewall, diamond, triangle etc
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.15: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, acquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.16: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.17: MEASURED SECTION ID: Unique identifier assigned to a measured section, asurface outcrop where the physical characteristics of the rock can be described.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: PORTION DIAMETER: The diameter of the portion of the original sample that wascontributed to the new analysis sample.
Column Comment.21: PORTION LENGTH: the length of the portion of the original sample that wascontributed to the creation of a new analysis sample.
Column Comment.23: PORTION VOLUME: The volume of the sample portion that was taken to create anew sample. In some cases, small volumes may be taken from many samples andcombined to create a new sample. In this case, a record can be stored in this table todescribe each portion individually.
Column Comment.24: PORTION VOLUME ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: The original unit of measureused for the analysis sample volume. Common units are m^3, L or mL.
Column Comment.25: PORTION WEIGHT: The weight of the portion of the original sample that was used tocreate a new sample.
Column Comment.27: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.28: PROD_STRING_ID: Unique identifier for the production string.
Column Comment.29: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.30: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the project that was run during whichthe samples were collected.
Column Comment.31: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.32: SAMPLE PART IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the sample that was used as partof the input into this one.
Column Comment.33: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.34: CORE IDENTIFIER : Unique identifier assigned to each physical core within aborehole.
Column Comment.35: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.36: DIRECTIONAL SURVEY IDENTIFIER: Number uniquely identifying each directionalsurvey.
Column Comment.37: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.38: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
